page.title: 03GENERAL SUMMARY (2)
page.content: This area is almost entirely agricultural,the land being rich and fertile ,well drained and crossed numerous minor roads and farm tracks.Most farms rear cattle ,either for dairy produce or beef and one family ,the Wannops ,have a farm whose acreage is over 1100.They have many relatives who also own farms.(see Linstock Castle Farm) Some of the farmers interviewed said they were reducing their dairy herds because of E.E.C regulations and switching to beef instead.In this area farmers agreed that a farm must be at least 150 acres to support a prosperous dairy herd. The average size of fields in this area is 5 hectars.Our land covage survey shows a predominamtly grassland area _either grazing or for silage.
